blocks.name: getBerryByName
blocks.description: Returns information about berry

args.name: berryName
args.info: Id or name of the berry

blocks.name: getBerryFirmnessByName
blocks.description: Returns information about berries with provided firmness

args.name: berryFirmness
args.info: Id or name of the berry firmness

blocks.name: getBerryFlavorByName
blocks.description: Returns information about berries with provided flavor

args.name: berryFlavor
args.info: Id or name of the berry flavor

blocks.name: getContestTypeByName
blocks.description: Contest types are categories judges used to weigh a Pokémon's condition in Pokémon contests.

args.name: contestName
args.info: Id or name of contest type

blocks.name: getContestEffectById
blocks.description: Returns contest effect according to provided Id

args.name: contestId
args.info: Id of the contest type

blocks.name: getSuperContestEffectById
blocks.description: Returns super contest effect according to provided Id

args.name: contestId
args.info: Id of the contest type

blocks.name: getEncounterMethodByName
blocks.description: Methods by which the player might can encounter Pokémon in the wild, e.g., walking in tall grass.

args.name: methodName
args.info: Id or name of the method

blocks.name: getEncounterConditionByName
blocks.description: Conditions which affect what pokemon might appear in the wild, e.g., day or night.

args.name: conditionName
args.info: Id or name of the condition

blocks.name: getEncounterConditionValueByName
blocks.description: Encounter condition values are the various states that an encounter condition can have, i.e., time of day can be either day or night.

args.name: conditionValueName
args.info: Id or name of the condition value

blocks.name: getEvolutionChainById
blocks.description: Evolution chains are essentially family trees. They start with the lowest stage within a family and detail evolution conditions for each as well as Pokémon they can evolve into up through the hierarchy.

args.name: chainId
args.info: Id of the evolution chain

blocks.name: getEvolutionTriggerByName
blocks.description: Evolution triggers are the events and conditions that cause a Pokémon to evolve.

args.name: triggerName
args.info: Id or name of the evolution trigger

blocks.name: getGenerationByName
blocks.description: A generation is a grouping of the Pokémon games that separates them based on the Pokémon they include. In each generation, a new set of Pokémon, Moves, Abilities and Types that did not exist in the previous generation are released.

args.name: generationName
args.info: Id or name of the generation

blocks.name: getPokedexByName
blocks.description: A Pokédex is a handheld electronic encyclopedia device; one which is capable of recording and retaining information of the various Pokémon in a given region with the exception of the national dex and some smaller dexes related to portions of a region.

args.name: pokedexName
args.info: Id or name of the pokedex

blocks.name: getVersionByName
blocks.description: Versions of the games, e.g., Red, Blue or Yellow.

args.name: versionName
args.info: Id or name of the version

blocks.name: getVersionGroupByName
blocks.description: Version groups categorize highly similar versions of the games.

args.name: versionGroupName
args.info: Id or name of the version group

blocks.name: getItemByName
blocks.description: An item is an object in the games which the player can pick up, keep in their bag, and use in some manner. They have various uses, including healing, powering up, helping catch Pokémon, or to access a new area.

args.name: itemName
args.info: Id or name of the item

blocks.name: getItemAttributeByName
blocks.description: Item attributes define particular aspects of items, e.g. "usable in battle" or "consumable".

args.name: itemAttributeName
args.info: Id or name of the item attribute

blocks.name: getItemCategoryByName
blocks.description: Item categories determine where items will be placed in the players bag.

args.name: itemCategoryName
args.info: Id or name of the item category

blocks.name: getItemFlingEffectByName
blocks.description: Item categories determine where items will be placed in the players bag.

args.name: itemFlingEffectName
args.info: Id or name of the item fling effect

blocks.name: getItemPocketByName
blocks.description: Pockets within the players bag used for storing items by category.

args.name: itemPocketName
args.info: Id or name of the item pocket

blocks.name: getMachineById
blocks.description: Machines are the representation of items that teach moves to Pokémon. They vary from version to version, so it is not certain that one specific TM or HM corresponds to a single Machine.

args.name: machineId
args.info: Id of the machine

blocks.name: getMoveByName
blocks.description: Moves are the skills of Pokémon in battle. In battle, a Pokémon uses one move each turn. Some moves (including those learned by Hidden Machine) can be used outside of battle as well, usually for the purpose of removing obstacles or exploring new areas.

args.name: moveName
args.info: Id or name of the move

blocks.name: getMoveAilmentByName
blocks.description: Move Ailments are status conditions caused by moves used during battle.

args.name: moveAilmentName
args.info: Id or name of the move ailment

blocks.name: getMoveBattleStyleByName
blocks.description: Styles of moves when used in the Battle Palace.

args.name: moveBattleStyleName
args.info: Id or name of the move battle style

blocks.name: getMoveCategoryByName
blocks.description: Very general categories that loosely group move effects.

args.name: moveCategoryName
args.info: Id or name of the move category

blocks.name: getMoveDamageClassByName
blocks.description: Damage classes moves can have, e.g. physical, special, or non-damaging.

args.name: moveDamageClassName
args.info: Id or name of the move damage class

blocks.name: getMoveLearnMethodByName
blocks.description: Methods by which Pokémon can learn moves.

args.name: moveLearnMethodName
args.info: Id or name of the move learn method

blocks.name: getMoveTargetByName
blocks.description: Targets moves can be directed at during battle. Targets can be Pokémon, environments or even other moves.

args.name: moveTargetName
args.info: Id or name of the move target

blocks.name: getLocationByName
blocks.description: Locations that can be visited within the games. Locations make up sizable portions of regions, like cities or routes.

args.name: locationName
args.info: Id or name of the location

blocks.name: getLocationAreaByName
blocks.description: Location areas are sections of areas, such as floors in a building or cave. Each area has its own set of possible Pokémon encounters.

args.name: locationAreaName
args.info: Id or name of the location area

blocks.name: getPalParkAreaByName
blocks.description: Areas used for grouping Pokémon encounters in Pal Park. They're like habitats that are specific to Pal Park.

args.name: palParkAreaName
args.info: Id or name of the Pal Park area

blocks.name: getRegionByName
blocks.description: A region is an organized area of the Pokémon world. Most often, the main difference between regions is the species of Pokémon that can be encountered within them.

args.name: regionName
args.info: Id or name of the region

blocks.name: getAbilityByName
blocks.description: Abilities provide passive effects for Pokémon in battle or in the overworld. Pokémon have multiple possible abilities but can have only one ability at a time.

args.name: abilityName
args.info: Id or name of the ability

blocks.name: getCharacteristicById
blocks.description: Characteristics indicate which stat contains a Pokémon's highest IV. A Pokémon's Characteristic is determined by the remainder of its highest IV divided by 5 (gene_modulo).

args.name: characteristicId
args.info: Id of the characteristic

blocks.name: getGenderByName
blocks.description: Genders were introduced in Generation II for the purposes of breeding Pokémon but can also result in visual differences or even different evolutionary lines.

args.name: genderName
args.info: Id or name of the gender

blocks.name: getEggGroupByName
blocks.description: Egg Groups are categories which determine which Pokémon are able to interbreed. Pokémon may belong to either one or two Egg Groups.

args.name: eggGroupName
args.info: Id or name of the egg group

blocks.name: getGrowthRateByName
blocks.description: Growth rates are the speed with which Pokémon gain levels through experience.

args.name: growthRateName
args.info: Id or name of the growth rate

blocks.name: getNatureByName
blocks.description: Natures influence how a Pokémon's stats grow.

args.name: natureName
args.info: Id or name of the nature

blocks.name: getPokeathlonStatByName
blocks.description: Pokeathlon Stats are different attributes of a Pokémon's performance in Pokéathlons. In Pokéathlons, competitions happen on different courses; one for each of the different Pokéathlon stats.

args.name: pokeathlonStatName
args.info: Id or name of the pokeathlon stat

blocks.name: getPokemonByName
blocks.description: Pokémon are the creatures that inhabit the world of the Pokémon games. They can be caught using Pokéballs and trained by battling with other Pokémon.

args.name: pokemonName
args.info: Id or name of the pokemon

blocks.name: getPokemonColorByName
blocks.description: Colors used for sorting Pokémon in a Pokédex. The color listed in the Pokédex is usually the color most apparent or covering each Pokémon's body. No orange category exists; Pokémon that are primarily orange are listed as red or brown.

args.name: pokemonColorName
args.info: Id or name of the pokemon color

blocks.name: getPokemonFormByName
blocks.description: Some Pokémon have the ability to take on different forms. At times, these differences are purely cosmetic and have no bearing on the difference in the Pokémon's stats from another; however, several Pokémon differ in stats (other than HP), type, and Ability depending on their form.

args.name: pokemonFormName
args.info: Id or name of the pokemon form

blocks.name: getPokemonHabitatByName
blocks.description: Habitats are generally different terrain Pokémon can be found in but can also be areas designated for rare or legendary Pokémon.

args.name: pokemonHabitatName
args.info: Id or name of the pokemon habitat

blocks.name: getPokemonShapeByName
blocks.description: Shapes used for sorting Pokémon in a Pokédex.

args.name: pokemonShapeName
args.info: Id or name of the pokemon shape

blocks.name: getPokemonSpeciesByName
blocks.description: A Pokémon Species forms the basis for at least one Pokémon. Attributes of a Pokémon species are shared across all varieties of Pokémon within the species. A good example is Wormadam; Wormadam is the species which can be found in three different varieties, Wormadam-Trash, Wormadam-Sandy and Wormadam-Plant.

args.name: pokemonSpeciesName
args.info: Id or name of the pokemon species

blocks.name: getStatByName
blocks.description: Stats determine certain aspects of battles. Each Pokémon has a value for each stat which grows as they gain levels and can be altered momentarily by effects in battles.

args.name: statName
args.info: Id or name of the stat

blocks.name: getTypeByName
blocks.description: Types are properties for Pokémon and their moves. Each type has three properties: which types of Pokémon it is super effective against, which types of Pokémon it is not very effective against, and which types of Pokémon it is completely ineffective against.

args.name: typeName
args.info: Id or name of the type

blocks.name: getLanguageByName
blocks.description: Languages for translations of API resource information.

args.name: languageName
args.info: Id or name of the language
